... It could be dangerous to take the ship in.
Take the ship in where, sir?
Into the anomaly, Chief. Lay in a course to the exact center. Transfer all available power to the shields.
Sir... can you give us some explanation?
No. I cannot.
Captain, so far we've obeyed every order -- no matter how far-fetched it might have seemed. But if we're to risk the safety of the ship and crew... I think we have to ask you for an explanation.

I know all of you have doubts about me... about each other... about the ship. All I can say is that even though we've only been together for a short time... I know that you are the finest crew in the fleet... and I would trust each of you with my life. I'm asking you to make a leap of faith -- and trust me.
Shields up, maximum strength.
Boosting field integrity on the warp nacelles. We may encounter shearing forces once we enter the anomaly.
I am preparing to initiate a static warp shell.
Course laid in, sir.
All decks report ready, Captain.
Chief... take us in.
Captain, I have an idea. If we take the ship to the center of the anomaly and create a static warp shell...
... a static warp shell, it could repair the barrier and collapse the anomaly.
Yes, sir.
Mister Data, you're a clever man -- in any time period.
Lay in a course to the center of the anomaly. Prepare to initiate a static warp shell.
The other two Enterprises... they're on their way.
Very well. Ensign... take us in.
We're entering the anomaly, sir.
All hands brace for impact!
The temporal energy's interfering with main power. Switching to...
... auxiliary power. I'm having trouble keeping the impulse engines on-line! I've got power fluctuations all across the board!
Maintain course and speed! Mister Data, how long until we reach the center?
Another thirty seconds at least, Captain.
We've entered the anomaly.
We have reached the center, sir.
Initiate warp shell!
Initiating static warp shell -- now.
Is it having any effect?
Something is happening... A new subspace barrier appears to be forming --
Captain! Sensors are picking up... two other ships...
Captain, It appears to be working. The anomaly is beginning to collapse. I think that --
Sir -- the temporal energy is rupturing our warp containment system!
We must eject the core!
No. We have to maintain the static warp shell for as long as possible!
We're losing containment! I can't stop it, it's going to --
Transfer emergency power to the anti-matter containment system!
I'm trying, sir... but there's a lot of interference...
The warp shell is definitely having an effect, sir. The anomaly is collapsing --
The containment system's going -- I can't hold it --
Maintain position! Mister La Forge --
Both of the other ships have been destroyed.
Two down... one to go.
Data, report!
The anomaly is nearly collapsed...
We're losing containment...
Goodbye, Jean-Luc. I'll miss you. You did have so much potential. But I guess... all good things must come to an end.
Containment field at critical! I'm losing it --
The Continuum didn't think you had it in you, Jean-Luc... but I knew you could.
Are you saying it worked? We collapsed the anomaly?
Is that all this meant to you? Just another spatial anomaly... just another day at the office?
Q, did it work?
You're here, aren't you? You're talking to me, aren't you?
What about my crew?
"The anomaly... my crew... my ship." I suppose you're worried about your fish too. Well, if it puts your mind at ease, you've saved humanity once again.
Thank you.
For what?
You had a hand in helping me get out of this.
I was the one who got you into it, Jean-Luc. That was the directive from the Continuum. The part about the helping hand... was my idea.
I sincerely hope this is the last time I'll find myself here.
You just don't get it, do you, Jean-Luc? The trial never ends.
We wanted to see if you had the ability to expand your mind and your horizons... and for one brief moment, you did.
When I realized the paradox...

Exactly. For that one fraction of a second, you were open to options you'd never considered. That's the exploration that awaits you... not mapping stars and studying nebulae... but charting the unknowable possibilities of existence.
What are you trying to tell me, Q?
You'll find out. In any case, I'll be watching... and if you're lucky, I'll drop by to say hello from time to time. See you out there.
Captain, are you all right?
Worf... what's the date?
Stardate 47988.
Is something wrong, sir?
No, no... in fact, I think I'll go back to bed. I could use some sleep.

Captain's Log, supplemental. Starfleet Command reports no unusual activity along the Neutral Zone, and there is no sign of a temporal anomaly. It would appear that I am the only member of the crew to retain any knowledge of the events I experienced.
That's it for me.
There's always next time.
That's four hands in a row. How does he do it?
I cheat.
I'm kidding.
I've been thinking... about all the things the Captain told us about the future. The way we changed and drifted apart... why would he tell us what's to come?
It sure goes against everything we've heard about not polluting the time line...
I believe, however, that this situation is unique.

Since the temporal anomaly did not occur, there have already been changes in the way this time line is unfolding. The future we experience will undoubtedly be different from the one the Captain encountered.
Maybe that's why he told us. Knowing what that future could bring... gives us a chance to change things now.
So that some things never happen.
Come in.
Am I too late?
Not at all. Have a seat.
What's the game?
Five card draw, deuces wild.
Come.
Captain. Is there a problem?
No. I just thought I might... join you this evening. If there's room...
Of course.
Would you care to deal?
Oh... thank you.
I should have done this a long time ago. I was quite a card player in my youth, you know.
You were always welcome.
So. Five card stud, nothing wild. The sky's the limit.
Personal log, Stardate 47391.2. I am returning from the Bat'leth competition on Forcas Three. The conditions were difficult... several contenders were maimed. But I was triumphant...
I won "Champion Standing."
I look forward to resuming my duties aboard the Enterprise. However, I am anticipating a... troubling situation.

It looks like we're going to have to head out to the Argus Array. This is the third time in the last year it's stopped relaying data. Starfleet's beginning to think it may be more than a simple malfunction.
I want you to start a long range scan as soon as we enter the --
Are you listening to me, Lieutenant?
Oh... yes, sir.
You seem pretty tense for a man who just came back from vacation.
Today... is my birthday.
What's the matter with you?
Because it is my birthday... I assumed that you or one of the others would try to mount an unexpected... social gathering.
You mean a surprise party? Worf, I hate surprise parties. I would never do that to you.
I am... sorry, Commander.
Why don't you settle in and I'll meet you on the Bridge.
Aye sir.
SURPRISE!!
Actually, Worf, I love surprise parties.
(sung to the tune of "For He's A Jolly Good Fellow") "Cha Worf Toh'gah-nah lo Pre'tOk... Cha Worf Toh'gah-nah lo Pre'tOk... Cha Worf Toh'gah-nah lo Pre'tO-O-O-O-Ok... Tu Mak Dagh Cha doh Borak!"
That was not a Klingon song.
It wasn't easy to translate. There doesn't seem to be a Klingon word for "jolly".
It's traditional for the birthday boy to cut the cake.
Captain Picard sends his birthday wishes. He was needed on the Bridge.
Happy birthday, Worf.
Thank you....
Ah... a painting.
Yes. I have entered my Abstract Expressionistic phase. This is my interpretation of the Battle of HarOS.
The Battle of HarOS... ?
I think it's wonderful. And I know just where to hang it...
What are you doing?
I always thought this room could use a little more color.
Battle of HarOS, right?
You alright?
I believe Commander Data's painting is making me dizzy...
I thought this cake was chocolate...
Don't I wish.
This is from Alexander. He gave it to me before he left to visit your parents.
What is it?
Alexander's forehead. The ridges of a warrior.
He really wished he could've been here when you got back from shore leave. You should have seen him, Worf... he stayed up all night talking about how proud he was of his father.
Thank you for watching him while I was away.
It was my pleasure.
So... how old are you, Mister Worf?
Captain -- I was told you couldn't attend.
I wouldn't miss this for the world. How old are you?
I am... old enough.
Report.
The Array appears to be functioning normally, sir.
That can't be right. We were told it stopped relaying data six days ago.
The Array is still transmitting data. However, it is no longer sending that information to the Federation. It appears that someone has redirected its imaging systems.
Where is the information being sent now?
Sector One-nine-six-five-eight. I am unable to access the Array's main computer, so it is impossible to determine the exact location.
What's in that sector?
It is uninhabited. But there could easily be a ship, or a subspace relay station receiving the data.
Captain. I suggest we beam a repair crew aboard the Array. We can download the imaging logs -- find out what the Array's been observing for the past six days.
Make it so.
Excuse me, Counselor. Do you have a moment?
Of course.
I have been meaning to speak with you... about Alexander.
Oh?
It has never been easy for me... having Alexander on board. I have always tried to be a good father... to give him guidance... but he seems to have his own mind about some things.
Most children do.
I could not have gotten this far without your help. Alexander looks up to you. At times, I have felt that you are like a mother to him.
Worf... that's one of the nicest things anyone's ever said to me.
Once, when I thought I was going to die... I asked you to watch over Alexander. I was wondering... if you might consider formalizing that arrangement. I want you to be Alexander's SohchIm.
His "Soh-chIm"?
You would become his surrogate mother. In case anything ever happened to me, you would be responsible for him.
Worf, I don't know what to say. It's a great honor. So this would make me your...
The closest analogy would be... step-sister.
That would make my mother your step-mother.
I had not considered that... It is a risk I am willing to take.
I accept.
Lieutenant Worf, please report to Engineering.
On my way.
We have analyzed the imaging logs. It appears that the Array was reprogrammed to observe several Federation sites.
This is Deep Space Five... Starbase Forty-seven... the Iadara Colony... and this is the Utopia Planitia Shipyard.
The Utopia Planitia shipyard... they're responsible for new starship development...
Someone is using the Array for covert surveillance of the Federation.
That is our theory. We believe that unauthorized access was made six days ago. The imaging logs from that day show a ship approaching the Array...
That's a Cardassian ship. Galor Class.
We're only three light years from Cardassian space. They would've had easy access to the Array.
Mister Worf, start a long range scan of the region... see if there are any Cardassian ships nearby.
Aye sir.
Here's a propulsion analysis of the Cardassian ship. You might try scanning for its energy configuration.
Are you alright, Lieutenant?
I feel... dizzy...
Worf, you don't look so good. Maybe you should go to Sickbay...
Yes... perhaps I will.
Any nausea... or blurred vision?
No. However, I did experience dizziness earlier today... at my birthday celebration.
It sounds like you're having a few side-effects from the concussion. I'll give you vertazine for the dizziness... but I want you to get some rest.
Doctor... perhaps you are thinking of another patient. I have no concussion.
Worf... you came in here this morning complaining about a ringing in your ears. I scanned you... you had a concussion.
Are you telling me you don't remember any of this?
No...

Temporary memory loss is common with this kind of injury... Do you remember telling me about the Bat'leth tournament? You said one of the competitors hit you in the head... that's why you lost the match...
I won that tournament. I can prove it to you.
What's wrong?
It says... "Ninth Place."
This is not the same trophy... Someone is playing a trick on me.
Worf, try to calm down. Memory loss can be very disorienting...
The log... I recorded a personal log on my way back to the Enterprise.
Computer -- access personal logs on Shuttlecraft Curie. Show my log entry for Stardate 47391.2.
Personal log, Stardate 47391.2. I am returning from the Bat'leth competition on Forcas Three. The conditions were difficult... several contenders were maimed.
One of the contenders used an illegal T'gha maneuver against me. The judges chose to ignore it... and I was robbed of my rightful standing.
I was awarded "Ninth Place". I look forward to resuming my duties aboard the Enterprise. However, I am --
I do not understand...
I'm sure this must be very disturbing for you... but don't worry. Your memories will eventually return to normal.
The best thing you can do right now is settle back into your normal routine... but slowly.
Thank you, Doctor.
If you have any more problems with dizziness, let me know.
Lieutenant, have you completed the metallurgical scan of the Array?
Sir?
The metallurgical scan. Is it complete?
I do not remember you asking me to --
Captain. There is a Cardassian ship approaching. Galor Class.
Open a channel.
On screen.
This is Captain Jean-Luc Picard of the Starship Enterprise. You are in Federation territory. Please explain your presence here.
We were wondering the same thing about you, Captain. Why would Starfleet's flagship want to venture so close to the Cardassian border?
We are repairing one of our subspace telescopes.
I see. May we offer our assistance?
No, thank you. We have everything under control.
If you don't mind my asking... what exactly is this telescope of yours designed to do?
It's a long range subspace Array... it gathers data on astronomical phenomena.
I'm certain it would never be used to... "observe" a neighboring species.
Certainly not.
Well, then... best of luck with your repairs.
Just try to make certain that your studies are limited to... "astronomical phenomena".
Charming fellow.
Captain -- that ship was responsible for reprogramming the Array.
What do you mean?
It is the same Class and energy configuration as the ship we saw in the imaging logs.
Imaging logs... Are you saying you have evidence that the Cardassians tampered with the Array?
They have been using the Array as a surveillance device. You saw the logs yourself.
I haven't heard anything about this.
Neither have I.
Commander Data -- show them the imaging logs you downloaded from the Array.
I know of no such logs, Lieutenant.
Worf... are you feeling alright?
Yes.
Mister Data, perhaps you should re-examine the Array... see if you can find anything to support Worf's claims. In the meantime, Lieutenant... I think you should go to your quarters.
Doctor Crusher says I am experiencing further memory loss... but my instincts tell me it is more than that... I remember those imaging logs... I could tell you every detail... every word...
Worf, let's assume you're right for a second -- that things did happen as you remember them.

Are you saying that everyone's memory on this ship has been altered but yours? The only one of us who's had a recent head injury or mental stress is you. Isn't it more logical that your concussion is causing some memory problems?
Enter.
Hi, Worf. I wanted you to know that we re-examined the imaging logs. They don't show a Cardassian ship... or any evidence that the Array was reprogrammed.
From what we can tell, the Array suffered a simple mechanical failure.
That is not right. I am certain that --
What's wrong?
The painting Commander Data gave me...
It has moved.
Worf, I hung that painting there... at your birthday party. Remember?
No...
The painting has changed... don't you see it?
Your hair... and your clothing... they have changed, as well...
Worf, maybe you should --
Now, Mister Worf! Now!
Worf, what are you waiting for? Raise shields.
This panel configuration has been altered, sir. I do not know how to --
Direct hit -- Engineering Section, Deck Forty-two. Shield generators are overloading.
Number One.
Firing photon torpedoes, full spread.
Direct hit on their main reactor... they're returning fire!
Captain, we have sustained heavy damage to our deflector systems. Hull breaches on Decks Seventeen and Thirty-six.
Ensign, take us out of here, maximum warp.
Are they pursuing?
No, sir. But they're firing on the Argus Array... They've destroyed it, sir.
Bridge to Engineering. Status, Mister La Forge?
This is Ensign Hayes, sir. Commander La Forge has been taken to Sickbay with plasma burns... There's serious damage to the secondary plasma conduit... but I think we've got it under control.
Acknowledged. Ensign, lay in a course for Starbase One-two-nine.
What happened back there, Lieutenant?
I believe I had another... memory loss.
"Memory loss"... What are you talking about?
I do not feel well, Captain. Request to be temporarily relieved of duty.
Granted.
Computer -- access personal logs on Shuttlecraft Curie. Play log entry for Stardate 47391.2.
There is no log entry for that Stardate.
Computer, display any log entries regarding the Bat'leth Tournament on Forcas Three.
Personal log, Stardate 47391.2. There has been a malfunction in the ship's main deflector. It will require two more days of repairs.
As a result, I will not be able to compete in the Bat'leth tournament on Forcas Three. I have asked my brother to take my place. He does not have my prowess with the blade, but --
Why'd you lock the door?
Why shouldn't I?
I heard about what happened on the Bridge. Are you all right?
I am not sure...
Do you want to talk about it?
I would rather not, Counselor.
Very well, Lieutenant.
Hot chocolate.
Is there something I can do for you?
Actually, there is...
I want you to sit down. Relax for a minute.
You're really tense.
Worf... I know you don't want to talk about what happened on the Bridge... but there are times when it's best to open up... Come on... if you can't talk to me, who can you talk to?
I do not believe this is appropriate behavior!
Not even for your wife?
Wife!
Worf, what's wrong?
I do not know... things are... changing...
What's changed?
I do not remember us... you and I... being mates... It is as if events... circumstances... continue to change from moment to moment... but I am the only one who seems to be aware of it...
So... are you saying you don't remember the last three years? You don't remember us falling in love... and getting married?
I do remember the last three years... but they are different. We did not have this relationship. We were friends. The Enterprise did not have a battle with the Cardassians...
No one believes me.
Worf... whatever's wrong... whatever's happened... I want you to know that I believe you... And that I love you. We'll find out what's happening...
I am initiating a subspace scan to search for temporal anomalies on or off the ship.
Counselor Troi, please report to Sickbay.
On my way. Let me know if you find anything.
Commander... how long have I been married to Counselor Troi?
Two years, one month and twelve days.
And when did this... relationship begin?
It is my understanding that your romantic affiliation began soon after you recovered from your spinal injury on Stardate 45587.
I remember that... A cargo container fell on me.
That is correct. After that, I observed that you and the Counselor began to spend more time together.
When did it become... romantic?
It was approximately six months later that you asked Commander Riker for his formal permission to court Counselor Troi. You felt that to do otherwise would be dishonorable.
And then we mated.
I am not privy to the exact details of when, where and how the first coupling took place. I could investigate it if you --
No... that is alright.
I am detecting no temporal anomalies in this system.
Perhaps we should try to pinpoint the exact moment when events became discontinuous. Do you remember the first change?
I went to Sickbay. Doctor Crusher told me I had a concussion... but I do not remember that happening.
Think back. Are you sure that was the very first change? Perhaps there was one before you entered Sickbay?
Before...
Yes... yes. In Engineering. I felt a wave of dizziness... and when I looked up, you and Commander La Forge were on the opposite side of the room. Captain Picard was gone.
I thought I had blacked out for a moment, and had not observed your movements.
And at my birthday party... the cake was chocolate, then it was yellow. And Commander Riker told me the Captain was not going to attend... then suddenly the Captain was there.
We should try to find any commonalties in these events. Where were you each time?
I was at the party... then I was in Engineering... then in my quarters...
What about the people you were with? Was there anyone who was present at all three events?

Everyone was at my birthday party... then I was with Counselor Troi... then Commander La Forge entered... Geordi was in all three locations. And he was near me in each case, just before I noticed the differences. Do you think there is a connection?
It is possible. We should speak with Commander La Forge.
Doctor, is Geordi well enough to answer some questions?
I'm afraid not, Data. Geordi's dead.
There do not appear to be any unusual readings. Energy residuals from the plasma burns... the beginnings of cellular decomposition...
I see nothing that connects these bio-readings to your recent sense of discontinuity.
What about his VISOR?
I still see nothing unusual.
Perhaps we should activate it.
Hook it up to the diagnostic array and I'll check it out.
The VISOR is active.
Worf... are you alright?
Have you noticed another discontinuity, Commander?
A moment ago, Doctor Crusher was not here. It was... Doctor Ogawa.
Doctor Ogawa?
And my uniform is different... what is my rank and position?
You're a Commander... and First Officer.
Are we still married?
Yes...
I am detecting a quantum flux in your cellular RNA...
What does it mean?
I do not know. I will have to analyze these readings...
I have found that the quantum flux in Worf's cellular RNA extends to the subatomic level. It is asynchronous with normal matter. In essence, Captain -- Mister Worf does not belong in our universe.
What?
All matter in the universe resonates on a quantum level with a unique signature. This signature is a constant. It cannot be changed by any known process. It is the basic foundation of existence.
And you believe that Worf's quantum signature is different from ours...
Yes, sir. I cannot explain it. It is as if he originates from a different quantum universe.
But he's standing right here in front of us. He's been on the ship for seven years.
I cannot explain that either. According to my understanding of physics, Worf should not exist.
You say these discontinuities started to occur after you returned from a Bat'leth tournament on Forcas Three.
Yes sir.
Now, I know for a fact that you didn't attend that tournament... and that no shuttlecraft has left the Enterprise for over a month.
I understand. But I also clearly remember attending the tournament, and returning to the ship in a shuttlecraft.
Do you remember the course you took to return to the ship?
I think so.
Let's backtrack that course... see if there are any unusual readings or anomalies.
Aye, sir.
If I may inquire, sir... how long have you been Captain?
Four years. Ever since Captain Picard was killed during an incident with the Borg. You don't remember any of this, do you?
I do remember. I just remember it differently.
Captain -- I'm picking up a minor subspace disturbance off the port bow.
Full stop. Analysis, Data.
It appears to be a guantum fissure in the space-time continuum.
On screen.
The anomaly cannot be seen. However, I believe I can enhance it with a warp field to make it visible.
Is it dangerous?
Not at this distance, sir. I am also detecting an ion trail intersecting the phenomenon. I believe it was left by a Starfleet type-six shuttlecraft.
So I was here...
I have an explanation, sir.
I believe the quantum fissure we discovered is a fixed point across the space-time continuum -- a "keyhole" that intersects many different quantum realities.
What do you mean by "quantum realities"?

For any event, there is an infinite number of possible outcomes. Our choices determine which outcome will follow. But there is a theory in quantum physics that all possibilities that could happen do happen in alternate quantum realities.
For instance, in a different quantum reality, Captain Riker may have chosen to sit at the other end of the table. While in another reality, the Captain may be standing.
So at this moment, there are an infinite number of Enterprises... and an infinite number of Doctor Crushers having this discussion.
Yes. Although on some of those Enterprises, there may not be a Doctor Crusher...
And somehow I have been shifting from one reality to another...
That is correct.
How did this happen?
When Worf's shuttlecraft made contact with the quantum fissure, I believe its warp engines caused a small break in the barriers between quantum realties. Worf was thrown into a state of quantum flux.
He immediately began to shift to other realities.
And Geordi's VISOR somehow triggered that...
Exactly. The VISOR uses a subspace field pulse. I think that whenever Geordi came near Worf, the field pulse intensified the quantum flux and pushed Worf into another reality.
How can we find my original quantum state... and return me to it?
Data... what if we scanned the quantum fissure using a subspace differential pulse? Maybe we could locate the quantum state that shares Worf's signature... and find a way to get him back.
An excellent idea, Lieutenant.
Proceed.
Worf...
From what I understand, there's a good chance that my Worf won't return... And I guess it's just hard for me to accept that there's a reality out there where you never loved me...
Deanna... I have always considered you a close friend.
And although I have never seriously considered a romantic relationship... I am not opposed to the possibility...
And what about our children?
Children...
You didn't know?
When the last shift occurred in Sickbay, we did not have children...
We have a little girl... Shannara. She's two years-old. And we have a three year-old boy. Eric-Christopher.
What about Alexander?
Alexander?
He was my son... in another reality.
I've used a differential pulse to analyze over ten million quantum states within the fissure... but I still haven't found the one with your signature. This may take some time, sir.
Captain -- there is a Bajoran ship approaching.
Red Alert.
Sir... the Bajorans?
Ever since the Bajorans overthrew the Cardassian Empire, they've been getting more and more aggressive.
Yesterday they destroyed one of our subspace telescopes... they thought we were using it to spy on them.
They're charging their weapons, sir...
Shields!
Return fire!
Captain, they've damaged our power systems -- it's caused an energy surge within the subspace pulse.... The quantum fissure is beginning to destabilize.
Can you disengage the pulse?
Too late, sir.
What the hell's happening?
The barriers between quantum realties are breaking down. Other realties are emerging into our own.
The Bajoran ship is disengaging.
The rate of quantum incursions is increasing exponentially. At this rate, the sector will be completely filled with Enterprises within three days.
Sir -- we are receiving two hundred eighty-five thousand hails from other ships.
I wish I knew what to tell them... Data -- can we stop these incursions?
Perhaps -- if we find the ship which matches Commander Worf's quantum signature.
How would that help?

It was Worf's shuttlecraft which traversed the fissure and weakened the barriers between quantum realities. If he re-enters the fissure in his original shuttle, and emits a broad-spectrum warp field -- it may be enough to seal the fissure and stop additional realities from emerging into our own.
Then what? How do we get the Enterprises that are already here back to where they belong?
In theory, the act of sealing the fissure should also restore the barriers between quantum states. The ships would return to their own realities.

Lieutenant Crusher, send out a general hail to all ships. This is Captain Riker of the Enterprise... that is, the Enterprise which is indigenous to this universe. We have all encountered a quantum anomaly. We think we have a way to return all of us to our proper realities. We need to find the ship which exhibits a particular quantum signature. Our Mister Data will transmit the signature to you now.
Anything?
There's too much com traffic, sir... it's tough to isolate who's talking to who... Wait. Here it is... one ship is responding...
Onscreen.
Captain... we appear to have the quantum signature you're looking for.
Data believes that by sending Worf through the fissure again, it would send all of us to our own realities.
Our Data has said the same thing.
We need you to send us your shuttlecraft Borges.
We'll prepare to launch it now.
It's... good to see you again, Captain. It's been a long time.
Did they send the right shuttle?

Yes. Its quantum signature matches Commander Worf's precisely. I have re-modulated the shuttle's engines to emit an inverse warp field. You will need to activate the field at the precise moment you enter the fissure.
Assuming it works... what will happen? Will I find myself near my own ship?

That is one possibility. However, the uncertainty principle dictates that time is a variable in this equation. You may end up several days before this event -- or several days after it. There is no way to tell.
I understand.
Good luck.
Goodbye, Deanna.
Setting course for the fissure...
Acknowledged.
Captain -- the shuttle is under attack!
The Bajorans again?
No sir -- it's one of the Enterprises. They're hailing us.
On screen.
We won't go back! You don't know what it's like in our universe. The Federation is gone -- the Borg are everywhere! We're one of the last ships left! Please, you've got to help us!
I'm sorry. There's no choice. If this works, everything will return to --
No! We won't go!
They're firing on the shuttle!
Open fire! Try to disable them!
Direct hit... their shields have collapsed... their engine core's overloading --
What happened?
It looks like their ship had already taken heavy damage -- their warp containment field must have been weak.
Probably from fighting the Borg...
Captain -- Worf is entering the fissure.
Charging primary systems... initiating inverse warp field...
Worf to Enterprise.
Enterprise here.
Captain -- is everything alright?
Yes, Lieutenant. Is there a problem?
I do not believe so. But I will explain when I arrive.
How was the Bat'leth tournament?
I won... "Champion Standing."
So you don't think this... quantum fissure is anything we have to worry about?
No. I believe the inverse warp field resealed it.
I look forward to reading your report.
Something wrong?
I know what you are planning. I will not be surprised.
Surprised? I don't know what you're talking about.
Of course you don't.
Worf... welcome home.
I hope you don't mind I let myself in. I promised Alexander I'd feed his Dalvin hissing beetle while you were both away.
So... you do not live here?
What is that supposed to mean?
It is a... long story.
Happy birthday. Wil wanted to give you a surprise party, but I knew you'd hate it... so I talked him out of it.
Thank you.
Well... I know Klingons like to be alone on their birthdays. I'm sure you have to meditate, or hit yourself with a pain stick or something.
Deanna... you do not have to leave.
Oh?
I have not had dinner. Would you care to... join me?
I'd love to.

"I have bedimm'd the noontide sun, call'd forth the mutinous winds, and 'twixt the green sea and the azur'd vault set roaring war: to the dread rattling thunder have I given fire, and rifted Jove's stout oak with his own bolt; the strong-bas'd promontory have I made shake and by the spurs pluck'd up the pine and cedar; graves at my command have wak'd their sleepers, op'd, and let 'em forth by my so potent art."

"But this rough magic I here abjure; and, when I have requir'd some Heavenly music -- which even now I do -- to work mine end upon their senses, that this airy charm is for, I'll break my staff, bury it certain fadoms in the earth, and deeper than did ever plummet sound -- I'll drown my book."
Captain, your attention is... wandering.
I can barely see.
Sir, I am supposed to be attempting a Neo-Platonic magical rite -- the darkness is appropriate to such a ritual.
PICARD This is a play, Data. The audience has to see you.
This is a play, Data. The audience has to see you.

Perhaps I have been too... literal with respect to my set design. Computer. Modify Holodeck program Data seven-three, Shakespeare's The Tempest, Act Five, scene one. Increase torchlight by twenty-percent.
Much better. Would you like to try it again?
Yes, sir... but I am not certain I fully understand the character of Prospero. I would appreciate any insights you may have which would improve my performance.
Well... Shakespeare witnessed the end of the Renaissance and the birth of the modern era. Prospero found himself in a world which no longer had any use for his powers...
Here he is about to perform one final creative act before giving up his art forever.
There is certainly a tragic aspect to the character.
Yes, but he had a certain... expectancy as well. A hopefulness about the future...
Shakespeare enjoyed mixing opposites...
Past and future... Despair and hope...
Data, is this part of your program?
No, Sir.
Then what is it?
It appears to be a steam locomotive.
A train?
If I am not mistaken.
Computer, end program.
Computer, end program...
Captain, you are injured...
It's just a scrape... I'll have it seen to...

The train we encountered is from one of Doctor Crusher's Holodeck programs. It is a re-creation of the Orient Express, a train which ran from Paris to Istanbul from the late nineteenth century until --
Yes, yes, I know about the Orient Express... but what was it doing on Prospero's Island?
There appears to have been a malfunction in the Holodeck's database retrieval system. The two programs were somehow temporarily linked together.
Could this malfunction affect the other Holodecks as well?
It is a possibility. I would have to run a diagnostic to be certain.
All right, get to it. And shut down all of the Holodecks until you're finished, just to be on the safe side.
Aye, sir.
I never realized you were interested in trains. Did you know that at its peak, the Orient Express carried over ten thousand passengers a year?
It's not really the train itself I'm interested in...
Then what?

The experience. The Orient Express was... mystery and romance. It was an elegant way to see exotic places and meet fascinating people... Did you know that on one trip, both Sigmund Freud and Gertrude Stein just happened to be on the same car? They ended up having dinner together every night.
I wonder what they talked about... ?
Why don't you take a trip yourself... and find out?
Riker to Picard.
Picard here.
All sections are ready to begin the survey, sir.
Very good. I'm on my way.
Think about that trip, Jean-Luc... You never know who you'll meet on the Orient Express...
Captain's Log, Stardate 47869.2. After weathering an unexpected magnascopic storm in the Mekorda Sector, we are continuing our search for new Federation colony sites.
I don't see any possibility of developing sites in this region. Most of the stars are mainsequence binaries with no M-class planets.
All right then, let's move on to the next survey region... Have stellar cartography begin a--
Mister Data, report.
The ship has gone into warp, sir.
Who gave the command?
Apparently no one. Helm and navigation controls are not functioning. Our speed is now warp seven-point-three and holding.
Picard to Engineering. Mister La Forge, what's going on down there?
I don't understand it, sir. The impulse systems suddenly cut out and the warp drive kicked in.
Geordi, can you take the engines off-line?
I'm working on it...
Data, what's our heading?
Bearing one-eight-seven mark four. I am unable to determine our destination -- but we are heading away from the Mekorda sector.
Captain, the computer's locked-out all the propulsion controls... I can't access any of the overrides... If you want us to stop, we'll have to do an emergency core shutdown...
That'll leave us without warp power for more than a week...
Begin the procedure, Mister La Forge...
We are no longer at warp... Impulse power has resumed... all systems show normal.
Where are we?
We are approximately thirty-billion kilometers from our original position.
Good work, Geordi.
It wasn't me that took us out of warp, sir. I didn't have time to complete the shut-down procedure...
Well, I want an explanation. Picard out.
Have you found anything, yet?
Only that we've got more than one mystery here, sir...
We still don't know why the ship jumped into warp... but it looks like we're lucky it did.
There was a theta flux distortion building up around the ship.
Why didn't the sensors alert us?
Our sensors were never designed to detect theta flux distortions. And yet -- there is a record of the distortion in the sensor log. That's the other mystery.
One fact is clear, however. The distortion was gaining in strength. If we had remained at our original position one-point seven seconds longer, the distortion would have ruptured our warp core.
If the Enterprise hadn't jumped into warp when it did... we would've been blown to pieces.
I just don't get it, Data. What could have caused the engines to jump into warp drive on their own?
Perhaps the engines were activated by a random power fluctuation.
Which occurred just in time to save the ship?
It is improbable... but it is possible.
Well, I don't think I'm ready to start believing in luck.

There is another possibility. The sensors apparently detected a dangerous anomaly that threatened the Enterprise. It is possible that they triggered a safety response which caused the ship to avoid destruction.
But there's no direct link between the sensors and the warp engines...
What is this... ?
It's some kind of new circuit node... and it's connected to at least half a dozen points in the sensor array...
It appears to be connected to several other systems as well... including the warp control circuits.
I guess there is a link between the sensors and the engines after all..
A force field... where did that come from?
I am not certain -- possibly from the node itself.
Well... wherever it came from... it sure doesn't want us messing with that node.
It appears to be protecting itself.
We found these "nodes" in several systems around the ship. At some level, they were all connected to each other.
There were nodes linking the sensors to our warp control and defensive systems. We believe this is why the ship jumped to warp.
When the sensors detected danger, the defensive systems reacted to the threat -- and activated the warp engines to protect us.
Where did these nodes come from?
It is possible that the magnascopic storm we recently experienced had an unexpected effect on the ship's systems.
Wherever they came from, they seem to be multiplying.
As they increase, it will become progressively more difficult to control the ship.
What do you propose we do?
Well, it's not going to be easy to get rid of them. When we attempted to examine the circuitry of one of the nodes, it generated a force-field to keep us out.
Whatever's going on here -- our first priority is to get back control of the ship.
Agreed...
All of the nodes intersect in Holodeck three. It appears to be a... focal point of some kind.
We might be able to find a way to use the Holodeck circuits to disable the nodes...
All right. Let's do it.
Commander, the Holodeck appears to be in operation.
I thought you shut down the entire system.
I did. However, it has reactivated itself... and it will not disengage.
Which program is running?
Several different programs appear to be running simultaneously.
Well... this should be interesting...
You weren't kidding, Data...
No, sir. I estimate that this... scene consists of portions of at least seven distinct Holodeck programs...
See if you can access the circuits that have been affected by the nodes.
Tickets please... please have your tickets ready...
You know, I've never even been away from home... and now I'm goin' all the way to Vertiform City!
Very nice, sir. Enjoy your trip.
Tickets please... please have your tickets ready...
Commander...
We have located a large concentration of nodes behind this wall... They appear to be connected directly to the Holodeck's main power coupling.
All right... go ahead and depolarize the entire power grid.
Get away from there...
Would you gentlemen care to show me your tickets?
We... left them in our compartments. I told you to bring the tickets.
I... forgot.
I don't think you folks belong on this train...
You leave these people alone! They're only trying to help!
Get back to the engine. This doesn't concern you.
They're trying to hijack the train...
Hey, if you're the Engineer, then who's doing the drivin'?
I am.
I'm all right...
It looks like the navigational relays overloaded...
I believe we have changed direction...
Now we're on the right track! Ladies and Gentlemen... we are on our way!
Picard to La Forge. What's going on? We just went into warp...
We've lost engine and helm control again, sir... but this time, they're completely burned out. I don't know if we can stop the ship.
I was right -- he was tryin' to make off with my brick.
You take good care of that -- we can't afford to lose it.
Are you people going to leave... or are we going to have to throw you off this train?
According to my tricorder, the Holodeck safeties have been disengaged. His weapon could be lethal.
All right... let's get out of here.

The number of systems now affected by the nodes has grown considerably. Sensors, engines, replicators, propulsion... they are all working together now, almost independently of the main computer. And the nodes link all of them through the Holodeck.
But why the Holodeck? That doesn't make any sense.
Commander, I think what happens on the Holodeck has a direct effect on the ship. When we attempted to destroy the nodes -- the characters on the train responded immediately to stop us.
And when the Engineer tried to protect us -- one of the characters shot him.
The Conductor then signalled for the train to change directions... and at approximately the same time --
-- the Enterprise took off in a new direction, too.
Are you saying... that the ship is being controlled by the Holodeck?
Not precisely.
Geordi, does the configuration of the connection nodes look familiar to you?
Yeah... it's... a little like the structure of your positronic brain.
That is correct. It appears that the nodes are in the process of creating a rudimentary neural net.
Data -- what are you suggesting?
Unlikely as it may sound... I believe that the Enterprise may be forming an intelligence.
This is a synaptic map of the human neo-cortex... This is a cross-section of my positronic net... And this is a schematic of the connection nodes linking the ship's systems...
I believe some sort of neural matrix is forming on the ship. It is still relatively primitive, but it is an intelligence nonetheless.
How could this happen?
I believe it is an emergent property.
Explain.
Complex systems can sometimes behave in ways that are entirely unpredictable. The human brain, for example, might be described in terms of cellular functions and neuro-chemical interactions.
But that description does not explain human consciousness -- a capacity that far exceeds simple neural functions. Consciousness is an emergent property.
In other words, something that's more than the sum of its parts...
Exactly.
How does that explain what's happening to the Enterprise?
The Enterprise contains a vast database of information which is managed by a sophisticated computer. This complex system gives the ship many of the characteristics of a biological organism.
That's true... it "sees" with its sensors... "talks" with its communications systems...
In a sense, it even "reproduces" with the replicators...
And you think the ship has somehow gone beyond those functions... has developed a new capacity...
Yes, sir. I believe a self-determining intelligence is emerging.
If that is so... what does the ship want? Where is it taking us?
I believe the key to understanding the ship's behavior lies in the Holodeck. All of the connection nodes intersect at that location. It is clearly some kind of processing center.
Processing center... ?
Yes, sir. A focal point... where all the ideas and instincts of this emerging intelligence are first expressed in some form.
Almost like an "imagination... "
Sir, I'd like to go to the Holodeck. I could interact with the characters... maybe find some clues that would help us understand what's happening.
Very well. Mister Data, Mister Worf, you'll go along. See if there's any way to re-establish control of the ship without destroying the nodes.
If this ship truly is an emerging intelligence, then it's our responsibility to treat it with the same respect we would give any other being.
Welcome aboard, Counselor...
If you will distract these people, I will attempt to depolarize the power grid.
Have you finished the puzzle yet?
Not yet... but we're gettin' close.
Do you recognize it?
No...
I'd like to help.
Tell me... exactly what are you making?
What do you think we're makin'? A puzzle!
No, I mean the picture. What is it?
I don't know.
Can you deal me in?
Sorry. It's a two-man game.
Hey, hey, hey -- keep your hands off that.
Is that why you killed the Engineer -- to get this brick?
I had to get it back. You know how much it's worth, lady? Plenty. And I gotta get it to Keystone City.
Why? What's at Keystone City?
That's where everything begins...
Gin.
Are you succeeding, Commander?
I am ready to access the main power grid.
Keystone City, next stop.
Well, look who's back.
We do not want any trouble, sir. We are simply... passengers.
Then I'm sure you wouldn't mind showing me your tickets?
Right. Sorry, boys... You're getting off right here...
This is my stop.
Wait -- tell me what happens at Keystone City. Why are you taking the brick there... ?
I think we should follow that man. That brick may be an important clue...
Where did he go... ?
scene: 38   EXT. HOLODECK/NEW YORK STREET - BROOKLYN SUBWAY - DAY

quote: I can access the power grid here.
scene: 38   EXT. HOLODECK/NEW YORK STREET - BROOKLYN SUBWAY - DAY

quote: I will attempt to depolarize the grid by using a low-frequency inversion field. That may disengage the nodes without destroying them.
scene: 38   EXT. HOLODECK/NEW YORK STREET - BROOKLYN SUBWAY - DAY

quote: There he is. I'm going after him.
scene: 38   EXT. HOLODECK/NEW YORK STREET - BROOKLYN SUBWAY - DAY

quote: I am coming with you.
scene: 38   EXT. HOLODECK/NEW YORK STREET - BROOKLYN SUBWAY - DAY

quote: What are you doing here?
scene: 44   EXT. HOLODECK/NY STREET - CONSTRUCTION SITE - DAY

quote: Laying the foundation...
scene: 44   EXT. HOLODECK/NY STREET - CONSTRUCTION SITE - DAY

quote: Now, if you'll excuse me, I've got a train to catch.
scene: 44   EXT. HOLODECK/NY STREET - CONSTRUCTION SITE - DAY

quote: I don't understand it, sir... Cargo Bay Five suddenly started to depressurize...
Did everyone get out in time?
Yes, sir, and I've re-established the containment field... But I'm reading massive power surges in the Cargo Bay, and all sorts of transporter activity... There's something weird happening, sir.
Get a team down there immediately. I want to know what's going on.
Aye, sir.
La Forge to Bridge...
Picard here... what's going on?
I wish I could tell you...
That man said he was "laying a foundation"...
scene: 50   EXT. HOLODECK/NY STREET - CONSTRUCTION SITE - DAY

quote: But a foundation for what... ?
scene: 50   EXT. HOLODECK/NY STREET - CONSTRUCTION SITE - DAY

quote: Troi to Data...
scene: 50   EXT. HOLODECK/NY STREET - CONSTRUCTION SITE - DAY

quote: Data here.
scene: 50   EXT. HOLODECK/NY STREET - CONSTRUCTION SITE - DAY

quote: How are you coming?
scene: 50   EXT. HOLODECK/NY STREET - CONSTRUCTION SITE - DAY

quote: I encountered a minor difficulty, Counselor...
But it has been dealt with. I am ready to depolarize the power grid.
It looks like the ship's replicator and transporter systems have been merged somehow... they're working together to create this... the question is, what is it?
Ensign, I want to run a full spectral analysis on --
I'm picking up a massive power fluctuation... the ship's losing structural integrity...
What's happening?
An earthquake... ?
Deanna!
La Forge to Data -- stop what you're doing!
Acknowledged...
Data... I think we should get together and compare notes.
The ship was protecting itself again -- stopping us from interfering. Whatever it's doing -- it intends to continue.
I'm betting it all has something to do with the object that's forming in the Cargo Bay.

I think he's right, Captain. Look at the common themes that are playing out on the Holodeck. A puzzle being put together... a foundation being laid... a paper doll being fashioned. All images of something being constructed.
And an object in the Cargo Bay that's being constructed -- atom by atom.
What is this object?

I have no idea. It's composed of silica polymers, duranium, and a few other compounds we can't identify. But creating it has put quite a strain on our systems. Warp power has dropped forty-seven percent...
Counselor, were you able to draw any other conclusions from your experience on the Holodeck? Anything that might help us handle this situation?

I think the Holodeck is what might be called the ship's "imagination." It's full of fanciful, metaphoric imagery -- as though it's having some kind of... daydream. It may not make literal sense... but symbolically there's probably some kind of logic to it.
The characters you spoke to... do they have any particular significance?
I think they represent various aspects of the ship. The Engineer, for instance... may have represented the navigational system. The Gunslinger could be the weapon system...
Is there any possibility that we might be able to persuade them to give back control of the ship?
I'm not sure it's possible to reason with them. Many of them seem genuinely unaware of what's going on... and of their role in it.

It's as though this emergent intelligence is still an infant... acting on instinct, trying to figure itself out as it goes. The only source of experience it can draw on is ours -- through our Holodeck programs.
Is there a way to... relate to them on their own level... influence their behavior in some way... ?
Maybe there is. I'd like to go back and try.
Deanna, the injuries you got on the Holodeck could have killed you...
And so far, we haven't been able to re-establish the safeties.
I'm aware of that.
Go ahead, Counselor. But keep this in mind... so far, we've tried to thwart the ship in all its efforts. And that's gotten us nowhere. Maybe it's time to try cooperating.
You don't belong on this train!
Three for Vertiform City.
Guess I was wrong about you folks. Welcome aboard.
What was that?
We've been having some problems... the engine's running out of steam... I hope we make it to Vertiform City on time.
Is there anything we could do to help?
Well, I could use a pair of strong arms up in the Engine Room... maybe we could get back on schedule.
Why don't you go with him, Worf... We'll do what we can here.
'Scuse me... are we goin' to get there okay?
Of course we are. Don't worry about a thing. Now... I want you to tell me everything you know about Vertiform City.
Well... they got a restaurant there... where you can eat all you want, any time... it's the best food around...
Well, there's the coal and there's the boiler. Sure obliged for your help.
Well done, sir. I think this will make a difference, all right...
I don't know how or why, sir... but power's almost back to normal levels... life support systems coming on line on all decks.
What's our heading?
It looks like we're on course for... Tambor Beta-six. It's a white dwarf star...
That's the way... keep it steady... put your back into it!
scene: 61   INT. HOLODECK/TRAIN - ENGINE ROOM - THE FURNACE

quote: The ship is using a modified tractor beam to collect vertion particles from the star.
Vertion particles... "Vertiform" City. This is what the ship was looking for...
Sir, the particles are being routed through the transporter system -- and into Cargo Bay Five.
Geordi... what's going on?
The object's absorbing vertion particles, sir... and it's growing even faster than before. Sir... I'm picking up internal energy emissions from this thing...
What do you mean?
It's beginning to generate its own energy...
Can you be more specific?
I'm picking up coherent emissions... matter conversion... it's incredible...
Wait, something's wrong... we've got power fluctuations... the vertion absorption rate is dropping... What's happening to the particle beam?
The beam's exhausted the supply of particles in the star... there's nothing left to take out.
Captain -- the object's energy output is decreasing...
Something's wrong...
What is it... ?
This was supposed to be "Vertiform" City...
We've been on the wrong track all along!
Are you all right?
Yes... what happened?
The Conductor accidently derailed the train.
Data to Captain Picard...
Picard here.
We have had an accident in the Holodeck. Has anything happened to the Enterprise?
Yes -- a ship-wide shutdown. We've lost attitude control and most systems are off-line.
Captain, I think you better take a look at this...
When the particle beam cut off, the object was beginning to form a coherent energy matrix...
... and if these readings are accurate, I'd say the emission patterns were almost... organic.
Are you suggesting that the Enterprise has been attempting to create... a lifeform?
I think so...
Will it... survive?
Its energy levels are dropping rapidly... Unless it gets an infusion of vertion particles pretty soon... I don't think so.
Captain, our systems are back on line... we're moving again -- at warp nine.
Let's get back to the Bridge.
Whew... that was a close one, wasn't it?
Where are we going now?
"New Vertiform City," of course.
Data to Captain...
Picard here.
The train has returned to normal, sir...
... and our destination is "New Vertiform City."
What's our course?
We're heading for the Cordannas system.
Another white dwarf star?
Yes. It's the closest one to our last position...
Captain, we've got a problem...
Even at warp nine, the Cordannas system is over twelve hours from here...
Will the object in the cargo bay survive that long?
I think it will, sir, but that's not the problem... The ship's diverted all of our systems to maximize propulsion -- including life support. We've got less than two hours of reserve oxygen.
Mister Data, we have to stop the Enterprise. That means you have to get control of that train.
Understood, sir.
The ship is looking for vertion particles... and it believes that the Cordannas system is the closest source... Is there another source -- something closer?
White dwarf stars are the only natural source, sir.
Then what about artificial sources? Is there any way to create them?
How did the Conductor stop the train?
There is a braking lever in the engine room.
Let's go...
Sorry, folks. But you ain't goin' nowhere.
I've narrowed the search to the MacPherson Nebula, which is a supernova remnant... or Dikonalpha, a class-nine pulsar...
They're both fairly close to our current flight path... and either one might produce vertion particles if we detonated a modified photon torpedo inside it.
Vertions usually occur in miniscule amounts. Do you think either of these phenomena can produce enough of them?
That's hard to say. I can't even guarantee that we can create them at all.
Well, we have to give it a try. The nebula or the pulsar? It's your choice, Mister La Forge.
I think we should go for the nebula.
Very well. Begin the torpedo modifications.
Now let's hope we can get the ship to go where we want it to.
Please listen to me. We understand what's happening. We know you must get to New Vertiform City. And we want to help you get there.
I dunno...
Please. We're your friends.
Well... you're really gonna help get us to New Vertiform City?
Yes. I promise.
Okay. But just one of you. The rest stay here.
All right, that's far enough.
Sorry to spoil your party, pal... it's nothing personal.
I can get us there more quickly. I know a shorter route.
Don't listen to him -- he's up to somethin'.
A shorter route... ?
Yes. If you will let me handle the controls.
Don't do it!
We're behind schedule now... if he could get us there on time...
Go on. But no funny stuff.
Data to Captain Picard...
I have taken control of the engine room.
Stand by. Are we within sensor range of the nebula?
Yes, sir.
Mister Data, try to slow us to impulse speed.
I will attempt to do so.
I sure hope you know what you're doing...
Are the torpedo modifications complete?
Aye, sir.
Launch torpedo.
It's working, sir... the reaction's producing vertion particles...
Well, what do you know... we're here...
New Vertiform City...
The nodes are deactivating all over the ship. Our systems are beginning to function normally again.
Then the purpose of the ship's intelligence... was simply to bring that life form into being...
There are entire species whose sole purpose in life is to reproduce. And when they finally procreate... they die.
Captain, look...
Cheers.
Captain's Log, supplemental. The Enterprise is back under our control. All traces of the emergent intelligence are gone... and the object it created has disappeared into space...
Come.
Captain, I am staging a scene from The Tempest this evening for a small audience. I would like you to attend.
I'd be honored. Which scene?
Miranda's first encounter with other human beings.
"Oh brave new world that has such people in it."
It seemed appropriate.
Captain. You took a significant risk in allowing the Enterprise to complete its... task.
Why do you say that?
Because the end product was unknown. The object could have been dangerous. It may in fact, be dangerous...
And I've allowed it to go off on its merry way.
Yes, sir.

The intelligence that formed on the Enterprise... it didn't just come out of the ship's systems -- it came out of us. Our mission records, our personal logs, even our Holodeck programs -- our fantasies.
If our experiences with the Enterprise have been honorable...
Then can't we trust the sum of those experiences to be the same?
Come in!

quote: I do not understand. Why is Spot under the bed?
scene: 1    INT. GEORDI'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON DOOR

quote: Probably because she knows I'll kill her if I get my hands on her.
scene: 1    INT. GEORDI'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON DOOR

quote: Has Spot been misbehaving?
scene: 1    INT. GEORDI'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON DOOR

quote: That's putting it mildly. So far she's broken a vase and a teapot, destroyed my couch by using it as a scratching post, and coughed up hairballs on my carpet.
scene: 1    INT. GEORDI'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON DOOR

quote: These incidents are common to cat owners. When you borrowed Spot, you said you wanted to experience the full range of feline behavior before getting a cat yourself.
scene: 1    INT. GEORDI'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON DOOR

quote: Yeah, well, I don't think I'm ready for one. You can take her back, with my blessings.

quote: Well? Go ahead -- call her.

scene: 1    INT. GEORDI'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON DOOR

quote: She won't come when you call her?
scene: 1    INT. GEORDI'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON DOOR

quote: No.
scene: 1    INT. GEORDI'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON DOOR

quote: Data, have you ever considered training her?
scene: 1    INT. GEORDI'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON DOOR

quote: I have never found it to be necessary.
scene: 1    INT. GEORDI'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON DOOR

quote: Necessary? That cat is out of control.
scene: 1    INT. GEORDI'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON DOOR

quote: Half the time I wasn't sure if she was going to lick me or scratch my face off.
scene: 1    INT. GEORDI'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON DOOR

quote: I have never experienced that kind of behavior from Spot. Although she does have the unfortunate habit of jumping onto my computer console when I am working.
scene: 1    INT. GEORDI'S QUARTERS - ANGLE ON DOOR

quote: There, see? She needs training.
